        last_value = arr[r]
        r += 1
    return last_value

The loop continues until `r` (the index of the current element) reaches the length of the array `arr`. This invariant is maintained throughout the loop because each iteration updates `last_value` based on the previous iteration's output, ensuring that `last_value` always points to the last element of the array.

Therefore, this loop invariant proves the partial correctness of the provided program.
